usefulItems: baking sheet, parchment paper, pastry brush, biscuit cutter (2½ in.), oven
title: Virginia Sweet Potato Biscuits

ingredients.content: 9 oz all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
6 oz unsalted butter, cubed, chilled, plus extra to serve
3 oz buttermilk, plus extra to brush

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.
Place flour, butter, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg into mixing bowl and mix <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>.

Add sweet potato and buttermilk and mix <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>, then knead <b>20 sec/<b>. Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface, dust top of dough with flour and gently press into a rectangle (approx. 1 in. thick). Fold dough into thirds, turn 90 degrees, flatten and repeat until you have folded the dough 4-5 times. Gently press to a 1 inch thickness.

Dip a biscuit cutter (2½ in.) into flour to prevent dough from sticking. Cut out biscuits by pushing cutter into dough starting around outside edges and working towards center. Gently press remaining dough together and repeat procedure.

Place dough pieces onto prepared baking sheet leaving approximately one inch between each biscuit. Brush tops with buttermilk and bake for 15-18 minutes (400°F) until golden brown. Serve with butter and honey.

hintsAndTricks: To make your own sweet potato purée: place 3 oz sweet potatoes, cubed, and 1 oz water into mixing bowl and cook <b>7 min/212°F/speed 1<b>, until fork tender. Mix <b>30 sec/speed 2.5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and let cool before using.
